description: Circa 17th century, from Latin officiātus, perfect passive participle of officiō (“conduct or perform religious services”), from Latin officium (“official duty, service”).

verbs.description: officiate (third-person singular simple present officiates, present participle officiating, simple past and past participle officiated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, transitive) To perform the functions of some office.
examples: She officiated as registrar at the wedding.
She officiated the wedding as registrar.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, transitive, sports) To serve as umpire or referee.
examples: This is the second time he has officiated at a cup-final.
He's never officiated a cup-final before.
